page.title: 09STRADISHALL AND DENSTON
page.content: Stradishall has a number of restored thatched houses including several of large size. Home Farm has a central chimney with four tall shafts. Large orchards belonging to Justin Brookes surround the village, and there is a packing station and cool store for apples etc. The small Church of St Margaret has an old screen, some Tudor seating and an 18th cent pulpit. Part of the next village of DENSTON is within the area: in particular Denston Hall and Park. The large Hall is of many periods, but largely Georgian. It is moated. The owners were among the first to buy motor cars and local resident Alfred Hicks was under-chauffeur in the 1920s.
